div.head: Capitulum 3
How it should be understood that: for as many as have been baptized in Christ you have put on Christ
div.p:
Therefore it is asked, how the following should be understood:
As many as have been baptized in Christ, you have put on Christ
Gal. 3:27 .

It is able to be said, that who is in Christ, that is those who have been baptized in conformity of Christ, (such that namely that have died to the old sin, just as Christ to the old penalty) they put on Christ, whom they have indwelling through grace. It is also able to be explained in another way: For we say there are two modes of putting on Christ: either through receiving the sacrament, or the perception of the thing.

Whence
Augustine :
Men put on Christ sometimes upon the perception of the sacrament, other times up to the sanctification of life; and the that first case is able to be common to both the good and the bad, but the later is proper only to the good and the pious.
Augustine, De baptismo contra Donatistas, V, c. 24, n. 34 (PL 43: 193) . Everyone one therefore, who is baptized in the name of Christ, puts on Christ either through a perception of the Sacrament or according to sanctification.
